pullRequest.body:
Establish interval integrability for Real.log on arbitrary intervals, remove an unnecessary assumption in the theorem
 `integral_log` which computes the integrals, and remove the theorems `integral_log_of_pos` and `integral_log_of_neg` which are now superfluous. Add theorems concerning integrability of even/odd functions; these are used in the proof and might be of general interest. Minor docu change: Add a missing section heading in Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Integral/IntervalIntegral.lean

Rationale: I considered adding a new theorem rather than changing  `integral_log`, but I see no value in having a theorem with unnecessary assumptions.  For improved compatibility, I also considered depreciating `integral_log_of_pos` and `integral_log_of_neg` rather than removing them, but then the linter complained about unused assumptions in those theorems.

Breaking change: Deleted assumptions in `integral_log`. Removed theorems `integral_log_of_pos` and `integral_log_of_neg`. These are replaced by `integral_log`, which gives the same conclusion without assumption.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).

(The assignee field is more used for somebody to signal "I feel responsible for making sure this PR gets reviewed in time, not the PR author.)
@grunweg Thanks for your extremely fast reply (on a Sunday!). I will follow your suggestions. Thank you for explaining the assignee field.
@grunweg @joneugster I believe I merged/implemented all your suggestions. Thanks again for all your help.

thanks!

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.

bors r+
Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12786398551/job/35643381326)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12786398551/job/35643381665)
Thanks for your PR! I left some minor comments, mostly about writing things more compactly. When you have addressed these comments, please remove the awaiting-author label again.
I might have made the two larger clean-ups on an old commit, so better double-check them before you incorporate them :)
Thanks! I just took a look from a style point of view again. (I don't have time for more this week, hopefully next one.) Here are a few more ideas from a "code golf" point of view.

I think the PR is in a concise state and should be mergable soon :) Things that should still happen:

1) Michael's comment about `âˆ€ x y,` should be addressed **(done)**
2) See if there are naming suggestions for the helper lemmas. **(no suggestions on Zulip)**
3) All other style/golf suggestions by Michael seem optional to me. You can incorporate them as you like or mark them as resolved if the suggested golfing doesn't work (or if you don't like it) **(done)**
In general, formalisation experience says that extracting intermediate lemmas is almost always useful. Can you extract this `have` into its own lemma?
```suggestion
```suggestion
Similarly here
Here's a small trick: you can write `have (t) : statement`, and avoid the `intro t` in the next line. (Also below.)

Do you know about dot notation already? This allows writing proofs like this more concisely, for instance (untested)
```suggestion
exact (this x).symm.trans (b := 0) (this y)
Then you could even combine this with the previous line, into `exact fun x y â†¦ (this x).symm.trans (b := 0) (this y)`

```suggestion
    rcases lt_trichotomy t 0 with h | h | h
You can combine subsequent calls to `rw`, like `rw [foo, bar]`. Also below.
Implemented. Thanks!

Can you *not* simply delete these lemmas please, but deprecate them instead? This way, somebody using them in a project depending on mathlib won't get errors "huh, my lemma is gone", but a warning "use lemma X isntead".

Write something like the following, right before the lemma to be deprecated
```
[deprecated (since := "2025-01-12")]
alias oldLemmaName := yourBetterReplacement

concretely, add this below your `integral_log`
```
@[deprecated (since := "2025-01-12")]
alias integral_log_of_pos := integral_log

@[deprecated (since := "2025-01-12")]
alias integral_log_of_neg := integral_log
```

Done, following the suggestion by @joneugster 
Thanks again.

This is a so-called non-terminal simp: these can make your code harder to maintain. One way to avoid them is replacing them by the equivalent `simp only`. In this case, a better fix could be to combine it with the next line to `simpa using ...`. Can you do that, please?
Implemented by @joneugster. Thanks

```suggestion
/-- The real logarithm is interval integrable (with respect to the volume measure) on every
interval. See `intervalIntegrable_log` for a version applying to any locally finite measure,
but with an additional hypothesis on the interval. -/
@[simp]
theorem intervalIntegrable_log' : IntervalIntegrable log volume a b := by
  -- Log is even, so it suffices to consider the case 0 < a and b = 0
  apply intervalIntegrable_of_even (log_neg_eq_log Â· |>.symm)
  intro x hx
  -- Split integral
  apply IntervalIntegrable.trans (b := 1)
  Â· -- Show integrability on [0â€¦1] using non-negativity of the derivative
    rw [â† neg_neg log]
    apply IntervalIntegrable.neg
    apply intervalIntegrable_deriv_of_nonneg (g := fun x â†¦ -(x * log x - x))
    Â· exact (continuous_mul_log.continuousOn.sub continuous_id.continuousOn).neg
    Â· intro s âŸ¨hs, _âŸ©
      norm_num at *
      have h := (hasDerivAt_id s).sub (hasDerivAt_mul_log hs.ne.symm)
      simp only [id_eq, sub_add_cancel_right] at h
      exact h
    Â· intro s âŸ¨hsâ‚, hsâ‚‚âŸ©
      norm_num at *
      exact (log_nonpos_iff hsâ‚).mpr hsâ‚‚.le
  Â· -- Show integrability on [1â€¦t] by continuity
    apply ContinuousOn.intervalIntegrable
    apply ContinuousOn.mono Real.continuousOn_log
    apply Set.not_mem_uIcc_of_lt zero_lt_one at hx
    simpa

```

stylistic suggestion, completely optional besides the part which avoids non-terminal `simp`, as mentioned above.

Note: I added the `(g := fun x â†¦ -(x * log x - x))` purely to make the goal on the next line to be displayed nicer in the infoview.

another optional cleanup suggestion. Maybe you'll want to choose better names for the extracted helper lemmas.

```suggestion
/-- Helper lemma for `integral_log`: case where `a = 0` and `b` is positive. -/
lemma integral_log_from_zero_of_pos (ht : 0 < b) : âˆ« s in (0)..b, log s = b * log b - b := by
  -- Compute the integral by giving a primitive and considering it limit as x
  -- approaches 0 from the right. The following lines were suggested by Gareth
  -- Ma on Zulip.
  rw [integral_eq_sub_of_hasDerivAt_of_tendsto (f := fun x â†¦ x * log x - x)
    (fa := 0) (fb := b * log b - b) (hint := intervalIntegrable_log')]
  Â· abel
  Â· exact ht
  Â· intro s âŸ¨hs, _ âŸ©
    have h := (hasDerivAt_mul_log hs.ne.symm).sub (hasDerivAt_id s)
    simp only [id_eq, add_sub_cancel_right] at h
    exact h
  Â· have h := tendsto_log_mul_rpow_nhds_zero zero_lt_one
    simp_rw [rpow_one, mul_comm] at h
    replace h := h.sub (tendsto_nhdsWithin_of_tendsto_nhds Filter.tendsto_id)
    simp only [id_eq, sub_self] at h
    assumption
  Â· apply tendsto_nhdsWithin_of_tendsto_nhds
    apply ContinuousAt.tendsto
    fun_prop

/-- Helper lemma for `integral_log`: case where `a = 0`. -/
lemma integral_log_from_zero {b : â„} : âˆ« s in (0)..b, log s = b * log b - b := by
    rcases lt_trichotomy b 0 with h | h | h
    Â· -- If t is negative, use that log is an even function to reduce to the positive case.
      conv => arg 1; arg 1; intro t; rw [â† log_neg_eq_log]
      rw [intervalIntegral.integral_comp_neg, intervalIntegral.integral_symm, neg_zero]
      rw [integral_log_from_zero_of_pos (Left.neg_pos_iff.mpr h), log_neg_eq_log]
      ring
    Â· simp [h]
    Â· exact integral_log_from_zero_of_pos h

@[simp]
theorem integral_log : âˆ« s in a..b, log s = b * log b - a * log a - b + a := by
  rw [â† intervalIntegral.integral_add_adjacent_intervals (b := 0)]
  Â· rw [intervalIntegral.integral_symm, integral_log_from_zero, integral_log_from_zero]
    ring
  all_goals exact intervalIntegrable_log'

@[deprecated (since := "2025-01-12")]
alias integral_log_of_pos := integral_log

@[deprecated (since := "2025-01-12")]
alias integral_log_of_neg := integral_log
```

```suggestion
lemma intervalIntegrable_of_evenâ‚€ (hâ‚f : âˆ€ x, f x = f (-x))
    (hâ‚‚f : âˆ€ x, 0 < x â†’ IntervalIntegrable f volume 0 x) (t : â„) :
    IntervalIntegrable f volume 0 t := by
```

everything before the `:=` is indented by 4 spaces. Likewise below
More code golf: can you write `simpa using h` instead? Perhaps even inline `h`?
Implemented.
Does `norm_num [(log_nonpos_iff hsâ‚).mpr hsâ‚‚.le]` work?

I can't make that work. It seems that one first needs to simplify hsâ‚ and hsâ‚‚ and then apply these simplified assumptions to the goal in a second step. The line `norm_num [(log_nonpos_iff hsâ‚).mpr hsâ‚‚.le]` does not do that in the right order.
Does `simpa using Set.not_mem_uIcc_of_lt zero_lt_one at hx` work?
I tried, but I was not able to make this work.
You can use more dot notation: `apply Real.continuousOn_log.mono`
Implemented
Does `simpa using `h` work here? Same as above.
It works great, and simplifies the code substantially.
Does `simpa using h` work?
Yes, works. I was able to squeeze this even more.
Can you write something like `exact ContinuousAt.tendsto (by fun_prop)`; or perhaps even combine this with the previous line?
Implemented.
You can combine these two rw lines.
Done.
If all these hypotheses fit on one line, I'd slightly prefer that.
They do fit in one line, compactified code as you suggested.

Mathlib has a rule "hypotheses left of colon", i.e. one would often prefer `(x y : \R) : IntervalIntegrable f volume x y` instead. Have you thought about this rule here? (Perhaps it's more useful to not follow it... but it would be nice to at least think about it.)
I was not aware of this rule. I changed the formulation following your suggestion here and elsewhere.

It's in the mathlib style guide: https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style.html
If you've never seen it, it's worth taking a look.

Indeed! I will definitively take a look (or two). 

@grunweg Thanks for pointing me to that document.
Same comment about "hypotheses left of colon".
See above. Changed following your suggestion.

I've asked about the naming of this and the helper lemmas below on [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/naming.20convention/near/493561117). If there are good suggestions there, I suggest using them, otherwise it's probably fine to leave the names as is.
Roger. I will come back to this tomorrow and see if someone made a good suggestion.
No one made a suggestion, not even a bad one. I would then leave the names as they are â€¦ and change them later if somebody complains.
agreed, the lack of response on Zulip usually means nobody deemed it 'obviously wrong', so leaving them as is seems reasonable
see above comment about naming
No one made a suggestion, not even a bad one. I would then leave the names as they are â€¦ and change them later if somebody complains.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: establish integrability and integrals of Real.log on arbitrary intervals
